decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with aggressive Merfolk creatures, utilizing Aether Vial to cheat them into play. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Daze to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Wasteland is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Kira, Great Glass-Spinner offers protection for key creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient Merfolk army, leveraging the synergies between the various Merfolk creatures in the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and disruption while also using cards like Stifle and Trinket Mage to maintain board control. The centerpiece of the deck is Phyrexian Dreadnought, a powerful creature that can be cheated into play with Stifle. The inclusion of Standstill allows the player to draw cards while their opponents are hesitant to play spells. Overall, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan, disrupt their strategy, and ultimately overpower them with card advantage and board presence.

The deck revolves around utilizing fast mana sources such as Lion's Eye Diamond, Dark Ritual, and Lotus Petal to generate a large amount of mana in a single turn. This allows the player to chain together spells like Infernal Tutor and Tendrils of Agony to create a lethal storm count and finish off the opponent in one explosive turn. The deck also includes various tutors and counterspells to help assemble the combo pieces and protect the combo from disruption. The key goal is to build up a high storm count and cast Tendrils of Agony for lethal damage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building card advantage through cards like Standstill and Brainstorm. The deck also includes utility lands like Mishra's Factory and Engineered Explosives to deal with threats on the board. The inclusion of cards like Humility and Elspeth, Knight-Errant provide additional ways to control the board and win the game. The goal is to outlast the opponent and eventually overwhelm them with powerful spells and creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage through powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and threats like Baneslayer Angel. Engineered Explosives and Relic of Progenitus provide additional disruption against graveyard strategies, while Glen Elendra Archmage offers a resilient threat. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the color requirements of the spells, allowing for consistent gameplay and powerful control options.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top work together to counter spells before they can resolve, while cards like Force of Will and Daze provide backup. Dark Confidant and Brainstorm help to maintain card advantage, while Tarmogoyf and Trygon Predator serve as threats. Vedalken Shackles and Sower of Temptation provide additional control elements. Overall, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually pulling ahead in resources.

The deck revolves around quickly deploying and buffing Goblin creatures to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive, fast-paced plays. By utilizing cards like Goblin Warchief and Aether Vial to reduce costs and speed up deployment, along with disruptive cards like Stingscourger and Goblin Lackey, the deck aims to consistently put pressure on the opponent early in the game. With powerful Goblin creatures like Goblin Piledriver and Goblin Ringleader, supported by tribal synergies and removal spells like Warren Weirding, the deck seeks to maintain board presence and close out games swiftly.

The deck focuses on utilizing Standstill to control the game by denying resources and slowing down the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's plays with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Snare, while also dealing with threats using removal like Swords to Plowshares and Lightning Bolt. The deck also has a strong land denial strategy with Wasteland and Crucible of Worlds, as well as a win condition with Mishra's Factory and Elspeth, Knight-Errant. Overall, the key strategy is to control the game through efficient use of resources and disruption.

The main idea of this deck is to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing counterspells like Force of Will and Counterbalance. The deck also aims to quickly ramp up with mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and use efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf to apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and versatile removal like Swords to Plowshares adds to the deck's flexibility and ability to adapt to different situations. Overall, this deck focuses on aggression while maintaining control of the battlefield.

This deck aims to lock the opponent out of resources by utilizing lands that can control the battlefield. By combining cards like Exploration, Manabond, and Life from the Loam, the deck can generate consistent land drops while also disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port. Intuition helps find key cards like Loam or Maze of Ith, while Mishra's Factory provides a win condition. The deck also includes a small toolbox of utility lands like Glacial Chasm and Ghost Quarter to deal with different threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands to control the game, with cards like Exploration, Wasteland, and Life from the Loam to disrupt the opponent's mana base. It also includes various tools for recurring lands, such as Crucible of Worlds and Eternal Witness. The deck aims to grind out value over the course of the game, with cards like Dark Confidant and Intuition providing card advantage. The presence of utility lands like Maze of Ith and Glacial Chasm allows the deck to play a defensive game while setting up a win condition through cards like Profane Command.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, discard effects like Cabal Therapy, and the repeatable card advantage of Survival of the Fittest. The strategy is to efficiently trade resources and disrupt the opponent's game plan while assembling key combo pieces like Academy Rector + Recurring Nightmare or Eternal Witness + Survival of the Fittest. The deck also includes a toolbox of creature cards that can be retrieved with Survival of the Fittest or Eternal Witness to adapt to different situations and outvalue the opponent.

Utilizing a combination of counter spells, card manipulation, and powerful creatures, this deck aims to control the game through countering opponent's spells and utilizing Counterbalance with Sensei's Divining Top to consistently counter spells of the same converted mana cost. The deck also features disruptive creatures like Rhox War Monk and Tarmogoyf to pressure the opponent while maintaining control. Firespout provides additional removal while Elspeth, Knight-Errant offers a finisher option. Overall, the key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Painter deck is to utilize the abilities of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill your opponent's entire deck in one turn. This combo can be supported by cards like Trinket Mage to fetch important pieces, as well as counter spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect your combo from disruption. Sensei's Divining Top, Brainstorm, and Ponder help with card selection and manipulation, while cards like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast provide additional disruption and control options. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and win the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on utilizing faeries and control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining board presence. The strategy involves countering spells, removal with cards like Spellstutter Sprite, Force of Will, and Lightning Bolt, while also utilizing powerful cards like Tarmogoyf and Mutavault for aggression. The deck also includes cards like Standstill and Vedalken Shackles to slow down the opponent's strategy. With a mix of counter spells, removal, and efficient creatures, this deck aims to outlast opponents and control the game until victory.

The deck focuses on maintaining control and tempo early in the game by using cards like Stifle, Spell Snare, and Daze to disrupt your opponent's plans. It aims to quickly establish a threatening board presence with efficient creatures like Nimble Mongoose and Tarmogoyf, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt to finish off opponents. The deck also utilizes card advantage and manipulation through Ponder, Brainstorm, and Vendilion Clique to ensure consistency in drawing crucial cards. Wasteland is used to disrupt opponent's mana base, while efficient lands like Tropical Island and Volcanic Island ensure smooth mana development.
